data.text: @digregjf @USMortality LOL. English is tough. Terrible at prepositional phrases attribution. I know what’s been happening. It’s just difficult to show strong evidence to judges and lawyers. I found a way though. Another week or two will show.

@JohnBeaudoinSr @USMortality The blue line is exactly that: the % change for that state relative to itself (2020/21 vs 2010-2019). It's hard to communicate on twitter. And yes, 41% increase is very bad. My bottom line: covid panic porn has been very bad especially for young working age people.
@JohnBeaudoinSr @USMortality And even inspecting individual death certificates is fraught. https://t.co/bfiRiCiiBi

@digregjf @USMortality Thx.  Now I get it. If I may, I'd say 'don't bury the headline'.  ~41% increase is huge on aggregate.  That's it.  I'd like to see the same graph, but the blue line would be each state's 20/21 avg relative to that state's prior 10yr avg and not the nation's avg. Interesting.

@JohnBeaudoinSr @USMortality The dashed line is the average % change across all states in the 2020-21 mean vs. the 2010-2019 mean. The 2010-2019 US mean DR was 1.27 deaths/1000. The 2020-2021 US mean DR was 1.79 deaths/1000. ~41% increase. Blue line is this by state. I agree with your take on low rates.

@digregjf @USMortality So ... the dashed line is 10yr mean for each state. The blue line is how far off  10yr mean the 2020to2021 mean is. Right?
Here's my take on that age group.  Deaths are so low regardless of covid or vax or suicide or OD, that it requires individual record inspection w/vax dates

@JohnBeaudoinSr @USMortality Here's the 2020-2021 (mean) vs. 2010-2019 (mean) % change in all-causes death rate by state for the 25-34 age group. The average across all states is a 41% increase. New Mexico had the highest increase in all-causes deaths for this age group, mostly deaths of despair, not covid. https://t.co/iZTVeF4hKG

@digregjf @USMortality CA FL flipped 43-year trend near end of 2020. Why? What happened then?
1)fent & meth up 1200% across southern border starting 2021. Thx Brandon
2)FL dropped masks/lockdowns Nov. Went normal. Vaxed elderly in 2021. Lower uptake younger ages. 
3)CA masks/lockdowns/vax2X3Xmoreharder
@USMortality Here's another (complimentary) way to compare CA and FL: all-causes deaths rates in the context of the past 43 years. https://t.co/2nz7t1TSwi
